result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Luis Wenceslao was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 2-1-17 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. Defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

With Huber privileges for actual work and 4 days credit.
Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose Luis Wenceslao

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Recalled.
Recalled.

Defendant Jose Luis Wenceslao in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Paul Michael Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, pay the surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  If the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 90 days at the House of Correction with Huber privileges for actual work and 4 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 2-1-17 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.
Branch 17 on jury trial on another matter, case spun to Branch 44 for sentencing hearing.

Defendant Jose Luis Wenceslao in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Elements and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 02-03-2016 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Jury trial on 02-03-2016 is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Letter from ADA Chojnacki dated 12-08-2015, received and filed. tk

Defendant Jose Luis Wenceslao in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Paul M. Hauer on behalf of Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for projected plea/sentencing hearing.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, requests case be set for Motion Hearing, Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Copies given to state and defense counsel. 
Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial Conference on 1/5/16 at 1:30 pm, and Jury Trial scheduled on 2/3/16 at 9:00 am, Branch 17.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 05, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Bail Refund Packets
All conditions remains the same.

Defendant Jose Luis Wenceslao in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless via telephone.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Court vacated bench warrant. Arguments heard as to bail. Court reinstated bail. Defense counsel received additional discovery today. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing hearing on 10-16-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled on October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 350.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Appearance prior to case being called: Attorney McCandless and ADA Danielle Chojnacki
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.  Cash bond forfeited per court order.

Defendant Jose Luis Wenceslao in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Zach Wittfchow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding Waukesha County Case #13CF001365 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Department Officer Guadalupe Velasquez.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose Luis Wenceslao in court.  Paul Hauer for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney McCandless was not able to appear, due to plea and sentencing in another trial court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jose Luis Wenceslao in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 07-15-2015 at 01:30pm
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 12/23/14.  VP
